resources.string:
\nBali is an Indonesian island known for its forested volcanic mountains, iconic rice paddies, beaches and coral reefs. To the south, the beachside city of Kuta has lively bars, while Seminyak, Sanur, Jimbaran and Nusa Dua are popular resort towns. The island is also known for its yoga and meditation retreats and if you are a nature lover you will be blessed with magnificent jungle and cliffs views.
From Mauritius to Bali, you can either transit via Singapore or to Dubai. The choice is yours. Their local currency is the Rupiah – A euro is about 17,000 Rupiah. The Balinese population is about 3.6 million, mostly Hindus. Try to avoid travelling to Bali between October – March, it is the rainy season, the Monsoon.\n
